sorular.soru: What should you do in this situation?
cevaplar: Use light signals and enter the other side of the road.
Slow down, use light signals, and drive carefully onto the verge.
Sound your horn, use light signals, and drive carefully onto the verge.
sorular.dogruCevap: Slow down, use light signals, and drive carefully onto the verge.

feedback.metin: If an overtaking, oncoming vehicle has misjudged a manoeuvre, warn them using light signals. Brake as much as possible in your own lane and, if necessary, steer onto the verge at low speed.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake here?

feedback.metin: If the broken line is next to your half of the road, you may overtake. This means that oncoming vehicles are not allowed to overtake.

sorular.soru: The lesson car has a weight in running order of 1200 kg and the trailer is unbraked. What maximum authorised mass of the trailer is allowed?

feedback.metin: Trailers do not need to have their own braking system if the maximum authorised mass does not exceed 750 kg and if the maximum authorised mass does not exceed half of the mass in running order of the car. In this case, the car weighs 1200 kg in running order. Half of this is 600 kg. Therefore, the trailer must not have a maximum authorised mass higher than 600 kg.

sorular.soru: You want to follow the road to the left. Should you give way to the cyclist?

feedback.metin: On an equivalent intersection, drivers must give way to drivers coming from the right relative to them. You are coming from the right relative to the cyclist. You therefore have the right of way over the cyclist.

sorular.soru: What kind of lighting should you use here?
cevaplar: You can choose between full-beam or dipped headlights.
sorular.dogruCevap: You can choose between full-beam or dipped headlights.

feedback.metin: Here you can choose between full-beam headlights or dipped headlights. Using the right lighting is very important, especially when it is dark. For example, you should use dipped headlights during the day when visibility is poor, in dark surroundings, and at night. Full-beam headlights are also allowed during nighttime when there is no oncoming traffic or other vehicles driving in front of you.

sorular.soru: Does a vehicle need to be reinspected if you install a gas installation?

feedback.metin: If the fuel type of a vehicle changes, it must be reinspected by the RDW. A new vehicle registration document will therefore also be issued.

sorular.soru: Do you have to give right of way to the pedestrian?

feedback.metin: You are leaving a 30 km zone, where the road is not laid out as an entrance or exit construction. You are not required to give right of way to pedestrians coming from the left or the right. Pedestrians are not drivers.

sorular.soru: What penalty can be imposed on a new driver if they choose to drive after consuming alcohol?
cevaplar: Only a LEMA course and a driving ban.
Only a fine and a driving ban.
A LEMA course, a fine and a driving ban.
sorular.dogruCevap: A LEMA course, a fine and a driving ban.

feedback.metin:
If you are caught driving in excess of the legal alcohol limit, you may be required to take a Light Educational Measure Alcohol (LEMA) course, even for as little as 0.5 
per mille. If your alcohol limit exceeds 0.8 per mille you could face an EMA course. For experienced drivers, these limits are slightly higher, namely 0.8 per mille for a LEMA and 1.0 per mille for an EMA. In addition to this course, you may also be fined and banned from driving.

sorular.soru: What is the permitted width of a trailer?

feedback.metin: Trailers can be up to 4 metres high, 2.55 metres wide, and 12 metres long.

sorular.soru: Are you pre-sorted correctly to make a left turn?

feedback.metin: You are allowed to pre-sort on a full one-way street on the left-hand side of the carriageway to turn left. However, this is not a full one-way street. The bottom sign indicates that the one-way street does not apply to cyclists, snorfiets riders, mopeds, and disabled vehicles. As these vehicles may approach from the other side, you must leave space for this and you can only pre-sort against the road axis. You are currently too far to the left.

sorular.soru: Should you always give way to fire engines?
cevaplar: Yes, even if it is not using optical or sound signals.
No, only if it is using both optical and sound signals.
No, only if it is using either optical or sound signals.
sorular.dogruCevap: No, only if it is using both optical and sound signals.

feedback.metin: Fire engines must only be given right of way if they are using both optical and sound signals. Blue flashing lights are the optical signals used by fire engines, while a two or three-tone horn is the sound signal.

sorular.soru: Do you have to give way to the pedestrian?

feedback.metin: If you want to turn off, you must always give way to traffic going straight on the same road. This also applies to pedestrians.

sorular.soru: What is the maximum allowed speed applicable for mopeds?

feedback.metin: A moped has a maximum construction speed of 45 km/h. This means that mopeds should never be able to ride faster than 45 km/h.

sorular.soru: Should you expect speed pedelecs on this carriageway?

feedback.metin: Speed pedelec riders are subject to the same rules as moped riders. Speed pedelec riders use the cycle/moped path, and when this path is not present, they use the carriageway. They are not allowed to use cycle paths. In this case, there is no cycle/moped path, but only a cycle path. Therefore, speed pedelec riders must use the carriageway.

sorular.soru: Can you drive like this?

feedback.metin: You have poor visibility from the front and side. Clear all windows and other glass (such as mirrors, headlights, brake lights, and rear lights) and the registration plates of snow and ice. Driving with poor visibility is not allowed.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to unload goods here?

feedback.metin: Stopping at a bus stop is prohibited. You are only allowed to pick up or drop off passengers quickly. Loading and unloading is prohibited.

sorular.soru: Should there always be an image of a bicycle on a cycle lane?

feedback.metin: A cycle lane is an area of the road separated from the carriage way by a solid or broken line with a bicycle painted on the road surface. If this marking of a bicycle is not applied, the lane is a suggestion cycle lane rather than an actual cycle lane.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the pedestrian?

feedback.metin: A person using a walker, a stick, or crutches is considered a 'person with reduced mobility'. It is mandatory to give way to people with reduced mobility when crossing the road, even if they are not using a pedestrian crossing. If a person is using a wheelchair or disabled vehicle, this rule does not apply.

sorular.soru: What is the quickest route to the centre?

feedback.metin: The time it will take to drive to the centre via the different routes is indicated on this board. The fastest route is via the s114.

sorular.soru: What should you do if this pictogram lights up on your dashboard?
cevaplar: Stop and call the garage or breakdown service.
Nothing. This means the passenger airbag has been disabled.
Stop and fasten your seat belt.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stop and call the garage or breakdown service.

feedback.metin: If this pictogram lights up on your dashboard, it means the airbag or the seat belt pre-tensioners are malfunctioning. This means you may have less protection in the event of an accident, so it is unwise continue driving. Stop in a safe place and call the garage or breakdown service.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive with defective rear number plate lights?

feedback.metin: Functional rear number plate lights are a permanent requirement, which means you cannot drive if they are defective. Lighting is not required for the front-mounted number plate.

sorular.soru: What is the best thing to do on a steep slope?

feedback.metin: If you want to drive up a steep slope, it is wise to shift down to a lower gear. A higher RPM makes better use of the engineâ€™s pulling power, which makes it easier to drive up the slope.

sorular.soru: Are you pre-sorted correctly here?

feedback.metin: You may never use a bicycle lane marked with a solid line to get into the right lane. So you are not pre-sorted properly here.

sorular.soru: Can you drive here with a vehicle combination that is 7.5 metres long and 2.1 metres wide?

feedback.metin: This road is closed to vehicles that, including their load, are wider than indicated on the sign. The combination is not wider than 2.3 metres so it may drive here. The sign does not say anything about length.

sorular.soru: Can you drive here?

feedback.metin: This road is closed to all motor vehicles. In some cases, certain types of traffic are exempt from road closures. Signs are used to convey these exemptions. In this case only tractors are exempt, which means cars are not allowed.

sorular.soru: What colour should the rear fog lights be?

feedback.metin: Rear fog lights may only be red. No other colour is permitted.

sorular.soru: What category of traffic does this child fall into?

feedback.metin: A horse rider or someone guiding a horse by the reins falls under the traffic category drivers. This is in contrast to someone who is pushing a bicycle or motorcycle by hand, which falls under the pedestrian traffic category.

sorular.soru: What is the speed limit for speed pedelecs on the carriageway within built-up areas?

feedback.metin: Speed pedelecs may ride on the carriageway both inside and outside built-up areas at a maximum allowed speed of 45 km/h. The speed limit is 40 km/h on cycle/moped paths outside built-up areas, and 30 km/h on cycle/moped paths inside built-up areas.

sorular.soru: Should you always drive off immediately when the traffic light turns green?
cevaplar: Yes. But only if you can clear the intersection immediately.
No. Driving off is not mandatory at a green light.
Yes. Under no circumstances should you keep standing still.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. But only if you can clear the intersection immediately.

feedback.metin: If the light turns green, you must begin driving if you can clear the intersection immediately. You may not unnecessarily obstruct other traffic. If you stop unnecessarily, you may be fined.

sorular.soru: Can you stop here to pick up or drop off a passenger?

feedback.metin: The sign E-6 indicates a parking space intended for the disabled. The supplementary sign indicates that only the vehicle with this registration number may park here. So you are not allowed to park here. However, you are allowed to stop briefly to let someone get in or out, and then drive off immediately.

sorular.soru: Should you use your indicator here?

feedback.metin: If you want to overtake on a motorway, you must use your indicator to move either left or right.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to enter this road?

feedback.metin: The sign indicates that this road is closed to motor vehicles with trailers. You are therefore not allowed to enter this road.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to flash your headlights here?

feedback.metin: You may only use sound and optical signals to prevent imminent danger. This is not an emergency situation, so you have to wait for the driver to move to the right.

sorular.soru: What phone number should you call in the event of an emergency?

feedback.metin: In the event of an emergency where you need help from the police, fire brigade, or ambulance, call 112. You can call the national number, 0900-8844, if you only need the police and do not need emergency assistance. If an animal is in distress due to, for example, a collision, you can call the animal police on 144.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive with a load that protrudes 1 metre from the front?

feedback.metin: This load is indivisible in its length, which means it can protrude up to 1 metre from the front. The load may also protrude up to 1 metre from the rear and no more than 5 metres from the centre of the rear axle.

sorular.soru: Which lines should you follow here?

feedback.metin: During roadworks, temporary yellow lines are often applied in addition to the existing white lines. The temporary yellow lines then apply, and the speed limit is often lowered to protect road workers.

sorular.soru: Is this child being transported correctly?

feedback.metin: This child is not being transported safely because the headrest is adjusted too high. The top of the headrest must be level with the top of the child's head to best prevent head and neck injuries in the event of a collision. In addition to that, the child is wearing a thick winter coat. This reduces the effect of the seat belt.

sorular.soru: This load is protruding 1.20 metres. Is it correctly marked?

feedback.metin: This load is only marked with a red flag. If an indivisible load in a trailer protrudes more than 1 metre, it has to be marked with a marking plate. The marking plate is best attached to the part of the load that protrudes the most. This load is not properly marked because it lacks a marking plate.

sorular.soru: Do the same rules apply for a trolley bus as for a public bus?
cevaplar: Yes. The same rules apply to trolley buses.
No. Trolleybuses must follow the same rules as trams.
No. There are separate rules for trolley buses.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. The same rules apply to trolley buses.

feedback.metin: Trolley buses do not fall under the traffic category trams, as they do not move on rails. Trolley buses are motor vehicles and are treated by law in exactly the same way as a public bus.

sorular.soru: Does positive and negative road banking affect road holding?
cevaplar: Both positive and negative road banking.
sorular.dogruCevap: Both positive and negative road banking.

feedback.metin: Road banking is a transverse gradient in a curve. Positive road banking means the outer side of the bend is higher than the inner side. Negative banking has the opposite effect. With positive road banking, road holding is better - the car 'sticks' better to the road surface, so to speak. With negative road banking, road handling is actually worse because the centrifugal force causes the car to veer out of corners earlier. Road banking therefore affects road holding in both scenarios.

sorular.soru: Can you stop here to call a garage regarding a technical fault with your car?

feedback.metin: This is a lay-by, which you may only use in case of a breakdown or an emergency situation. Using a lay-by as a rest stop, to make a phone call, or to check a map is prohibited. Calling a garage regarding a technical malfunction with your vehicle is categorised as dealing with a breakdown and is therefore allowed at a lay-by.
